content:
HttpApplicationState Class

Definition

Enables sharing of global information across multiple sessions and requests within an ASP.NET application.

In this Article

public sealed class HttpApplicationState : System.Collections.Specialized.NameObjectCollectionBase
Inheritance
Object
NameObjectCollectionBase
HttpApplicationState

Inherited Members

BaseClear()

Remarks

An ASP.NET application is the sum of all files, pages, handlers, modules, and code within the scope of a virtual directory and its subdirectories on a single Web server.

A single instance of an HttpApplicationState class is created the first time a client requests any URL resource from within a particular ASP.NET application virtual directory. A separate single instance is created for each ASP.NET application on a Web server. A reference to each instance is then exposed via the intrinsic Application object.

Application state is not shared across either a Web farm (in which an application is hosted across multiple servers) or a Web garden (in which an application is hosted across multiple processes on the same computer).

Properties

AllKeys

Gets the access keys in the HttpApplicationState collection.

public string[] AllKeys { get; }
Value
String[]

A string array of HttpApplicationState object names.

Contents

Gets a reference to the HttpApplicationState object.

public System.Web.HttpApplicationState Contents { get; }
Value
HttpApplicationState

A reference to the HttpApplicationState object.

Remarks

This property provides compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.

Count

Gets the number of objects in the HttpApplicationState collection.

public override int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of item objects in the collection. The default is 0.

Item(String)

Gets the value of a single HttpApplicationState object by name.

public object this[string name] { get; set; }
Parameters
name
String

The name of the object in the collection.

Value
Object

The object referenced by name.

Item(Int32)

Gets a single HttpApplicationState object by index.

public object this[int index] { get; }
Parameters
index
Int32

The numerical index of the object in the collection.

Value
Object

The object referenced by index.

StaticObjects

Gets all objects declared by an <object> tag where the scope is set to "Application" within the ASP.NET application.

public System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection StaticObjects { get; }
Value
HttpStaticObjectsCollection

A collection of objects on the page.

Remarks

Application objects are defined in the Global.asax file inside the <object runat="server" scope="Application"> </object> tags.

Methods

Add(String, Object)

Adds a new object to the HttpApplicationState collection.

public void Add (string name, object value);
Parameters
name
String

The name of the object to be added to the collection.

value
Object

The value of the object.

Clear()

Removes all objects from an HttpApplicationState collection.

public void Clear ();

Get(Int32)

Gets an HttpApplicationState object by numerical index.

public object Get (int index);
Parameters
index
Int32

The index of the application state object.

Returns
Object

The object referenced by index.

Get(String)

Gets an HttpApplicationState object by name.

public object Get (string name);
Parameters
name
String

The name of the object.

Returns
Object

The object referenced by name.

Remarks

The following example returns an object named MyAppVar1 from the HttpApplicationState collection of the intrinsic Application object and copies it to a new object variable. 

Dim MyObject As Object  
MyObject = Application.Get("MyAppVar1")  

Object MyObject;  
MyObject = Application.Get("MyAppVar1");

GetKey(Int32)

Gets an HttpApplicationState object name by index.

public string GetKey (int index);
Parameters
index
Int32

The index of the application state object.

Returns
String

The name under which the application state object was saved.

Lock()

Locks access to an HttpApplicationState variable to facilitate access synchronization.

public void Lock ();

Remarks

The HttpApplicationState class performs automatic locking and unlocking with the AllKeys and Count properties and the Add, Clear, Get, GetKey, Remove, RemoveAt and Set methods. However, explicitly using the Lock and UnLock methods when you have a series of operations may be more efficient.

Remove(String)

Removes the named object from an HttpApplicationState collection.

public void Remove (string name);
Parameters
name
String

The name of the object to be removed from the collection.

RemoveAll()

Removes all objects from an HttpApplicationState collection.

public void RemoveAll ();

Remarks

RemoveAll is an internal call to Clear.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes an HttpApplicationState object from a collection by index.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
Parameters
index
Int32

The position in the collection of the item to remove.

Set(String, Object)

Updates the value of an object in an HttpApplicationState collection.

public void Set (string name, object value);
Parameters
name
String

The name of the object to be updated.

value
Object

The updated value of the object.

UnLock()

Unlocks access to an HttpApplicationState variable to facilitate access synchronization.

public void UnLock ();

Remarks

The HttpApplicationState class performs automatic locking and unlocking with the AllKeys and Count properties and the Add, Clear, Get, GetKey, Remove, RemoveAt and Set methods. However, explicitly using the Lock and UnLock methods when you have a series of operations may be more efficient.

Thread Safety

This type is thread safe.
